_prev_prog_3.Description:
The J.R. Simplot Aberdeen Plant's Safety and Release Prevention
Program is composed of the following elements, which are all part of the
integrated safety management system. 1) Employees participate in the
elements of this safety and release prevention program wherever
possible; 2) Training is provided for operators and maintenance
personnel; 3) Process Safety Information (PSI) is maintained on ammonia
hazards and the refrigeration system; 4) A Process Hazard Analysis
(PHA) of the refrigeration system was conducted and is periodically
reviewed to ensure adequacy of controls; 5) The Mechanical Integrity
program ensures the system continues to operate as designed; 6)
Operating and Maintenance procedures provide operators and
maintenance staff the information necessary to safely operate and
maintain the system; 7) Contractors working on or near the refrigeration
system are selected for safety performance, and are briefed on the
hazards and safety requirements of the job; 8) Hot Work Permits are
required whenever welding, cutting, grinding or other activities are
conducted that could generate sparks and start a fire; 9) The
Management of Change (MOC) program requires that the impact of
changes to the refrigeration system be evaluated and approved prior to
the work being conducted; 10) Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSR) are
conducted prior to restart of the system after modifications to ensure that
impacts of the change are addressed; 11) Incident investigations are
conducted for incidents involving ammonia releases and near misses that endanger employees or the public; 12) Compliance Audits are conducted
every three years to ensure that the prevention program is meeting its
objectives; 13) Emergency Planning and Response ensures that
employees and emergency personnel are prepared to respond to an
ammonia release in accordance with the plant's emergency plan and that
notifications are made to designated points of contact at local, state, and
federal levels depending on the extent of the release.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A.  Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies

It is the intent of J.R. Simplot Company to provide a safe work environment for every employee and to protect them from injury and illness resulting from unsafe acts or conditions during hours of employment.  J.R. Simplot will also comply with all federal, state and local laws.  The Unit Director has the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program for its effectiveness and improvement and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions.



Ammonia safety programs are key items in the plant safety and health program.  J.R. Simplot takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increase that could cause a system failure, a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems.  A training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency response procedures which enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets.

The Boiler and Refrigeration Supervisor is responsible for the management of the ammonia safety programs.



B.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

J.R. Simplot Company Aberdeen Potato Plant produces frozen potato products for sale to the public.  The facility operates an ammonia refrigeration system to cool and freeze the food products and the production areas.  The maximum ammonia inventory at the plant is approximately 50,000 pounds.  Ammonia is the only regulated substance handled at the Aberdeen Plant.



C.  Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility has a program level 3 accident release prevention program for the ammonia system that complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Pro

gram Regulation.  The ammonia prevention program consists of the following elements:

o Employee Participation Program

o Process Safety Information

o Process Hazard Analysis

o Operating Procedures

o Training Program

o Contractor Safety Program

o Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

o Mechanical Integrity Program

o Hot Work Permit Procedures

o Management of Change Procedures

o Incident Investigation Procedures

o Compliance Audit Procedures



D.  Five-Year Accident History

No ammonia-related incidents were identified for the Aberdeen Plant during the previous five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences.  



E.  Description of the Emergency Response Program

An emergency response plan has been implemented at the Aberdeen Plant.  This response plant contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to fires, ammonia leaks and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.

The emergency response program includes the following elements:

o Fire Plan

o Ammonia Leak Procedures

o Evacuation Procedures



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The Aberdeen plant is currently updating the operating procedures covering the ammonia refrigeration system.  Operators will be training as the procedures are updated.  The updates to all operating procedures and training are anticipated to be completed before the end of the calendar year.
